thread.title: WEATHER ALERT: Brits face travel chaos as polar snow descends
thread.title_full: WEATHER ALERT: Brits face travel chaos as polar snow descends

title: WEATHER ALERT: Brits face travel chaos as polar snow descends
text:
Storm Doris is causing disruption across the UK today 1 / 22 
GETTY COLD: Despite winter coming to an end, forecaster predict cold chills soon “There is the possibility of a more prolonged cold spell, with an increased chance of snow” Met Office forecaster 
“There is the possibility of a more prolonged cold spell, with an increased chance of snow.” 
Consultant meteorologist Matt Hugo echoed the concerns as he believes cold polar air could spill south to chill Britain. 
He said: “A Greenland air pressure block may make an appearance, with cold weather arriving from the north or north-east.” 
GETTY DISRUPTION: Aside from the heavy snow, strong gusts of wind will pummel Britain 
March has hit between -7C and -18C in each of the past seven years, Met Office records show. 
And the spring forecast means Brits face more road and rail disruption, after the six-day February Big Chill with -10C lows, as well as Storm Doris last week. 
The Weather Outlook forecaster Brian Gaze said: “Spring could start on a wintry note, with a very cold and snowy spell during the first half of March.” Related articles
